Descriptions.Description: Voiced palatalized postalveolar (alveolo-palatal) plosive, used by sinologists
Voiced palatalized postalveolar (alveolo-palatal) nasal, used by sinologists
Voiceless palatalized postalveolar (alveolo-palatal) plosive, used by sinologists
Voiceless coarticulated velar and palatoalveolar fricative
Voiced strident apico-alveolar trill (e.g. czech ř)
Apical dental unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative - used by sinologists
Apical retroflex unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative - used by sinologists
Apical dental rounded syllabic alveolar fricative - used by sinologists
Apical dental rounded syllabic retroflex fricative - used by sinologists
Open central vowel used by sinologists, between [a] and [ɑ], = [ä] used unofficially as an open central vowel
mid front unrounded vowel between [e] and [ɛ]
